enrichment.personal_bio: Marketing executive and AAPI community advocate. Global Head of Social Marketing at Meta and Executive Director/Head of Meta Prosper. Angel investor with Hyphen Capital and advisor to early-stage consumer brands.
enrichment.career_background: Experienced marketing leader who has held senior brand and social roles at Meta (Global Head of Social Marketing; Head/Executive Director of Meta Prosper), Airbnb, Gap (Hill City), Snapchat and Nike. Active on several nonprofit/advisory boards including the Smithsonian Asian Pacific American Center, The Asian American Foundation (TAAF), Reimagine and LAAUNCH.
enrichment.investment_focus: Multi-stage investments in startups led by AAPI founders; consumer/DTC, social/advertising, and early-stage tech (seed to growth).

enrichment.personal_bio: Angel investor and former NVIDIA software engineer based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Active as an angel (listed as a Mera Ventures angel) with public profiles indicating a focus on AI and pre-seed investing. Maintains a public Twitter account @praveenakode.
interests: Supporting female founders and diversity in tech
enrichment.career_background: Worked as a software engineer at NVIDIA (public profiles list prior engineering tenure) and has been active as an angel investor since ~2019. Education listed on public profiles includes Texas A&M University and Andhra University. Public investor listings show small angel check sizes and a focus on pre-seed AI opportunities.
enrichment.investment_focus: AI and machine learning; pre-seed / early-stage startups; angel checks (~$1–100K), with emphasis on female founders and technical founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Life sciences investor and analyst focused on biotech and diagnostics. Senior Analyst at Northpond Ventures (2021–2024) and later an associate at DeciBio (2024–present). Holds an M.A. in Biotechnology from Columbia University and a BSc in Physiology from McGill University.
interests: Biotech industry research and market analysis
enrichment.career_background: Worked in venture and research roles across life sciences: Senior Analyst at Northpond Ventures (2021–2024); life‑sciences associate/consultant at DeciBio (2024–present). Prior experience includes research roles at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai and Intellia Therapeutics, internships at Xontogeny, RTW Investments and JPMorgan (life‑science equity research), and co‑founding the NYC chapter of Nucleate.
enrichment.investment_focus: Biotechnology, diagnostics, life‑science tools, digital health and therapeutics; invests across early stages (pre‑seed/seed) through growth-stage science‑driven companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Bain Capital Crypto focused on research-driven crypto investing. Previously a researcher at Placeholder working on early-stage DeFi, blockchain scalability, and privacy technologies. Has published research on financial protocols, consensus, and cryptography.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Bain Capital Crypto as a partner in 2021 (co‑leading the crypto team). Prior to that he was a researcher at Placeholder (early‑stage investing and protocol research) and earlier worked as an analyst at Lowe’s Ventures. Holds a BA in Economics from the University of Virginia and has published academic/technical research in crypto and quantitative finance.
enrichment.investment_focus: Crypto infrastructure and protocol investing (DeFi, L1/L2 scalability, data availability), privacy/cryptography, active governance participation; cross-stage (seed through growth)

enrichment.personal_bio: Software engineer, founder and angel investor. Co‑founder of Clearbit and founder/partner at Earl Grey Capital; creator of Reflect and other developer products. Active angel and seed investor focusing on developer‑first startups.
enrichment.career_background: Alex MacCaw is a self‑taught software engineer who worked on engineering teams at Twitter and Stripe before co‑founding Clearbit in 2014. He later stepped down from the Clearbit CEO role to focus on early‑stage building and investing, runs Earl Grey Capital, and builds products such as Reflect.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage, developer‑first companies — APIs, protocols, developer infrastructure, and web3/developer tooling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Tunisian entrepreneur and human-rights activist. Founder & CEO of Mos (consumer fintech focused on student financial aid) and former founder of the NGO Al Bawsala. Partnered with Sequoia (scout/partnered founder relationship) since 2020 and active as an angel/seed investor.
enrichment.career_background: Founded Al Bawsala (NGO) in Tunisia before moving into tech entrepreneurship; launched Mos in 2017 to help students access financial aid and later expanded into banking products. Recognized as a World Economic Forum Young Global Leader (co‑chaired Davos 2016); has served in advisory roles with Amnesty International and UNHCR. Began a scouting/partnered relationship with Sequoia Capital in 2020 and has made angel and seed investments.
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer fintech (student finance), education access/edtech, early-stage/seed and angel investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder & CEO of Lago, an open‑source billing platform (YC alum). Partner / limited partner at Orange Fund (Orange DAO) and an active angel investor in fintech and developer‑focused startups. Background in growth (ex‑VP Growth at Qonto) and SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Lago in 2021 and serves as CEO; previously served as VP Growth at Qonto and held roles at Mailjet and McKinsey. Active angel investor and limited partner (Orange Fund / Orange DAO), with personal investments across SaaS, fintech and developer tools.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) investments in Web3/Blockchain and FinTech, plus founder‑led SaaS and developer‑focused infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner / Partner at Hashed focused on global web3 investments. Former software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founder of a last-mile logistics startup, Carnegie Mellon alumnus. Active in investing and ecosystem-building for blockchain protocols, gaming/metaverse, and infra projects.
enrichment.career_background: Baek Kyoum Kim is a Partner (General Partner-level) at Hashed where he leads and sources investments in metaverse, gaming, protocol infrastructure, and broader web3 adoption. Prior to Hashed he was a software engineer at Amazon Web Services (IoT & Robotics), founded a last-mile logistics startup, and has participated in programs including the Google Lunar XPrize; he holds degrees from Carnegie Mellon and has written Hashed’s public investment posts and blog entries.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage and growth-stage web3/blockchain: protocol infrastructure (Layer-1/Layer-2, ZK), DeFi and infrastructure tooling, NFT/gaming & metaverse studios, developer platforms and crypto-native consumer apps.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital, an early‑stage venture firm based in San Francisco. Former Partner at Coatue Management and previously worked in private equity and management consulting. Stanford BA (History).
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and General Partner at A* Capital. Prior to A*, Siegel was a partner at Coatue Management (investing in companies including DoorDash, Instacart and Ramp), earlier worked in private equity at Altamont Capital Partners and began his career as a consultant at Boston Consulting Group. He holds a B.A. in History from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage technology (marketplaces, enterprise SaaS, consumer internet, AI, fintech); Seed to Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Convective Capital, a VC focused on wildfire (Firetech) solutions. Previously co‑founder & CEO of WePay (acquired by J.P. Morgan Chase) and a part‑time partner at Y Combinator. Based in San Francisco and Mendocino County; holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Boston College.
enrichment.career_background: Bill co‑founded WePay and led it through growth and acquisition by J.P. Morgan Chase in 2017, then ran Chase’s small business merchant services. He later served as a part‑time partner at Y Combinator and founded Convective Capital to invest in technology addressing extreme wildfires; he also serves on industry boards and advises startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Firetech and wildfire resilience technologies; early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) investments in startups addressing prevention, detection, suppression, grid and insurance resilience.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director at Next Play Ventures who coaches and invests in early‑stage founders alongside Jeff Weiner. Former VP and Chief of Staff at LinkedIn, where he helped run strategy, operations, and the Microsoft integration. Holds BSE and MSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan.
enrichment.career_background: Began his career as a consultant at McKinsey & Company, joined LinkedIn in 2012 in Business Operations and served for years as Chief of Staff (VP) to the CEO and Executive Chairman, leading strategic initiatives and the post‑Microsoft integration. Since 2020 he is Managing Director at Next Play Ventures; he has served on the board of Boys & Girls Clubs of the Peninsula and is a Fellow of the Aspen Institute.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (seed–Series A) startups in enterprise/SaaS, consumer internet, marketing technology and Web3/crypto; emphasis on founder coaching and operational scaling.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at AU21 Capital, a blockchain‑focused venture firm. Former bitcoin miner and early investor in multiple cryptocurrency projects and exchanges. Active advisor and investor across Web3, DeFi and blockchain infrastructure.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded AU21 Capital (2017) with Kenzi Wang to invest in blockchain and Web3 startups. Prior to AU21, ran large‑scale bitcoin mining operations and made early angel investments in blockchain projects and crypto exchanges; also serves in advisor roles to crypto projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Blockchain / Web3 / Crypto (pre‑seed to Series A); DeFi, NFTs/GameFi, blockchain infrastructure, mining and exchange partnerships.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and partner at Placeholder, a New York‑based venture firm focused on cryptoassets and decentralized information networks. Former Blockchain Products Lead at ARK Investment Management. Co‑author of the book "Cryptoassets: The Innovative Investor’s Guide to Bitcoin and Beyond" (2017). Based in New York City.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founded Placeholder in 2017 to invest in early‑stage tokenized networks and protocol infrastructure. Before Placeholder he led ARK Invest’s Next Generation Internet / blockchain efforts and later focused on blockchain products. He is a published author on crypto investing and has engaged in board/advisory roles for protocol teams and projects.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in decentralized information networks and token‑based protocols — cryptoassets, protocol infrastructure, Layer‑1/Layer‑2 and Web3 developer tooling; emphasis on tokenomics and long‑term network value accrual.

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and Co‑Head of Venture Capital at 10X Capital. Founder of Growth Technology Partners (acquired by 10X) and former partner at Flight Ventures; earlier co‑founder of isocket and RoomHunt. Has led 10X investments including Robinhood, Headspace and DraftKings; holds a BS from Indiana University and an MBA from Dartmouth (Tuck) and is reported to be pursuing a master’s in psychology at Harvard.
enrichment.career_background: Venture investor and entrepreneur — founded Growth Technology Partners (general partner), served as partner at Flight Ventures, and joined 10X Capital via the GTP acquisition to become General Partner / Co‑Head of Venture Capital and COO/Head of Origination on certain 10X vehicles. Prior to VC he co‑founded startups isocket and RoomHunt. Education: BS (Indiana University — Kelley) and MBA (Dartmouth — Tuck).
enrichment.investment_focus: Consumer‑oriented software and technology (FinTech, consumer internet, SaaS/EdTech, healthcare/life sciences); early‑to‑growth stage venture investments and partnerships with institutional capital.

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Contrary, a San Francisco–based venture firm that focuses on identifying and investing in early-career talent and early-stage technology companies. Contrary has been an early backer of companies including Ramp, Anduril, DoorDash and Vise. Tarczynski was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 (Venture Capital).
interests: Research and publishing on tech trends
enrichment.career_background: Eric Tarczynski founded Contrary (launched 2016/2017) and serves as its Managing Partner; the firm combines a scouting/talent network, in-house research, and seed/early-stage investing. Before Contrary he was an early employee at Kamcord and co‑founded a student payments startup; he also publishes Contrary Research and related publications.
enrichment.investment_focus: Talent-driven, early-stage technology investing (pre-seed/seed through Series A); sectors include fintech, enterprise software, consumer internet, and frontier/defense tech; primary geographies North America and India.

enrichment.personal_bio: Principal at gumi Cryptos Capital (gCC). Joined gCC in 2018 and focuses on sourcing and supporting investments—designing product and token models, finding product–market fit, and structuring partnerships and governance. Prior to gCC he worked in investment banking in San Francisco and holds a BS in Finance (minor in Cinematic Arts) from the University of Southern California.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in investment banking in San Francisco before joining gumi Cryptos Capital in 2018. At gCC he manages sourcing, executing, and supporting new investments with emphasis on token/product design, go-to-market, partnerships and governance; he has authored multiple gCC investment posts explaining lead/co-led rounds.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) blockchain & crypto startups — DeFi, protocol & infrastructure, NFTs/metaverse, web3 gaming; token models and governance.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pantera Capital focused on early-stage venture and token investing in blockchain and crypto. Former founding member of J.P. Morgan’s blockchain team (Onyx) and co‑founder of Scale8 Partners. Wharton School graduate.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Pantera Capital in 2019 and promoted to General Partner; leads investments across DeFi, infrastructure, and web3 gaming and supports portfolio development. Previously a founding member of J.P. Morgan’s blockchain group (Onyx), co‑founded Scale8 Partners (blockchain strategy/advisory), and worked in early‑stage venture at ff Venture Capital. Holds a B.S. in Economics from The Wharton School.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage Web3/blockchain and token investments (DeFi, infrastructure, web3 gaming); portfolio development and founder support

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and managing partner at Phenomenal Ventures. Former head of marketing/communications at AngelList, Plaid, Quora and early marketing leader at Dropbox and Facebook. Angel investor and advisor to dozens of startups; based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: 14+ years leading marketing at product‑first technology companies (Facebook, Dropbox, Quora, Plaid, AngelList) after starting in advertising; co‑founded Phenomenal Ventures in 2022 and serves as managing partner while also acting as an angel investor and advisor. Holds an MBA from UC Berkeley and MS/BS in Communications from University of Illinois Urbana‑Champaign.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed to Series A) enterprise software, fintech, and commerce; go‑to‑market/marketing‑driven startups; U.S.‑focused

enrichment.personal_bio: Howard Wu is a co‑founder and managing partner at Dekrypt Capital. He is also a co‑founder of Aleo and co‑founder & CEO of Provable, with a research background in cryptography and verifiable computing from UC Berkeley.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and Managing Partner at Dekrypt Capital (focused on privacy and blockchain infrastructure). Co‑founder of Aleo and co‑founder & CEO of Provable (privacy/zk developer tooling). Research background at UC Berkeley in cryptography and verifiable computing; previously held engineering roles at Google and Meta.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage blockchain infrastructure, privacy‑preserving technologies, zero‑knowledge proofs, and developer tooling for private applications

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of NEAR Protocol and General Partner at SID Venture Partners. Former engineering manager and AI researcher at Google Research; co‑author of the 2017 "Attention Is All You Need" (Transformer) paper. Active angel/strategic investor in AI and Web3 infrastructure startups.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder of NEAR Protocol (2017–present) and later appointed NEAR Foundation CEO; previously an engineering manager and researcher at Google Research working on TensorFlow and natural language understanding. Serves as a General Partner at SID Venture Partners and is an active investor in early‑stage AI and blockchain startups.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage (pre‑seed/seed) software startups — AI/ML, deep tech, Web3/blockchain infrastructure, B2B SaaS and FinTech; primary geographies CEE & global.

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director (growth) at Redpoint Ventures who focuses on AI, enterprise software and healthcare. Joined Redpoint in 2020; previously worked in product at Flatiron Health and held roles at Off Grid Electric and McKinsey. Holds a B.A. from Yale and an MBA from Wharton.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2020 and works on growth-stage investments in AI, enterprise software and healthcare. Prior roles include Product at Flatiron Health and work at Off Grid Electric and McKinsey. Education: B.A. in Economics & History from Yale; MBA from The Wharton School (Palmer Scholar).
enrichment.investment_focus: AI, enterprise software (SaaS), healthcare; primarily growth-stage investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Technology executive and angel investor based in San Francisco. Former Head of Engineering and later CTO at Plaid, and previously Director of Engineering at Dropbox. Active angel/co-investor (ASDF Ventures) with a focus on fintech infrastructure and enterprise/SaaS.
enrichment.career_background: Jean-Denis Greze is a technology leader and investor who joined Plaid as Head of Engineering in 2017 and was promoted to CTO in 2021; he previously served as Director of Engineering at Dropbox (2013	32017). He has been an active angel/co-investor through ASDF Ventures and publicly listed investments across fintech, developer tooling, and enterprise SaaS. In 2024 he co-founded Town, an AI-driven tax/services startup. Public bios list CS degrees from Columbia and a JD from Harvard Law.
enrichment.investment_focus: Fintech infrastructure and payments; developer APIs and tools; enterprise/SaaS (SMB-focused); angel and early-stage (seed to Series A) investments.

enrichment.personal_bio: Investor and operator focused on early-stage companies. Formerly VP of Corporate Development & Strategy at Twitter (employee #34) and a General Partner at GV; co‑founder of the #ANGELS investing collective. Co‑founder and Managing Director of Adverb Ventures, based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Jessica Verrilli began her career in venture and corporate roles, spent ~8–9 years at Twitter rising to VP of Corporate Development & Strategy (led acquisitions including Vine and Periscope), co‑founded the #ANGELS angel collective, served as a General Partner at GV, and in 2023 co‑founded Adverb Ventures where she is Managing Director. She holds a B.A. in Human Biology from Stanford University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early-stage (pre-seed through Series A); sector interests include enterprise SaaS, developer tools, fintech/financial infrastructure, marketplaces/labor platforms, healthcare/diagnostics, and crypto infrastructure.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner on Redpoint’s early-stage team; joined Redpoint in 2021 and focuses on enterprise software including developer tools, AI, security, and cloud infrastructure. Holds a BS and MS from Stanford University and previously worked at early-stage roles across startups and at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ. Active as a board observer / seed investor across multiple infrastructure and AI startups.
enrichment.career_background: Joined Redpoint in 2021 (Principal, later promoted to Partner in 2023) to invest in Seed/Series A enterprise companies. Prior roles include forward‑deployed solutions and engineering/product positions at C3.ai, Palantir and RelateIQ, and operating/investor roles at small startups; holds BS and MS from Stanford (Computer Science and Management Science & Engineering).
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and Series A enterprise software (developer tools, infrastructure, AI, security, and SaaS)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of On Deck and an active angel investor based in San Francisco. Serves as an investor/partner supporting founders through Kepler Operator’s Fund and related Kepler Ventures efforts. Focuses on early‑stage, operator‑led deals and founder network building.
enrichment.career_background: Co‑founder and leader at On Deck (founder fellowship and founder support programs). Earlier roles include growth at Virta Health and co‑founder of Within Health. Runs founder support and angel investing activities through Kepler Ventures / Kepler Operator’s Fund and a personal syndicate, backing many early‑stage companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & pre‑seed; AI and enterprise software; digital health; web3/DAOs; operator‑led, founder‑support investments

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner of Selva Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on consumer health & wellness brands. Previously a partner on CircleUp Growth Partners and a private equity investor at TPG; began his career in investment banking at Barclays. Serves on/observes multiple portfolio company boards.
enrichment.career_background: Kiva Dickinson founded Selva Ventures in 2019 and leads deal sourcing and execution for the firm. Prior to Selva he was a Partner at CircleUp Growth Partners (led Series B investments including Nutpods and Liquid I.V.), before which he worked in private equity at TPG in San Francisco and began his career in consumer-focused investment banking at Barclays in Los Angeles.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed & Series A consumer brands (health, wellness, beauty, branded CPG); primarily US & Canada.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Contrary (joined 2022), where he leads seed-to-growth investing and helped build the firm’s later-stage practice. Previously a growth investor at TCV and held investing roles at Coatue and Index Ventures. Publishes the Investing 101 newsletter and frequently speaks on AI and venture topics.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in growth and venture roles at TCV, Coatue, and Index/Index Ventures before joining Contrary as a General Partner in 2022 to lead later-stage and Series A investing. Educational background includes Brigham Young University and the University of Cambridge.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early- to growth-stage technology investments (AI, cybersecurity, enterprise software, fintech).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Paradox Capital and chief marketing officer at Wander. Former Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor and Head of Marketing at Fast. Hosts the Paradox Podcast and invests at seed/pre-seed in consumer and developer-focused startups.
enrichment.career_background: Kyle Tibbitts is a marketer‑turned‑investor who co-founded Paradox Capital to back founders outside Silicon Valley. He was the second marketing hire and Head of Brand Marketing at Opendoor, later led marketing at Fast, and joined Wander as CMO. He runs the Paradox Podcast and leverages his operator background to advise portfolio founders on product, marketing and go‑to‑market.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre-seed and seed-stage checks into consumer marketplaces, travel/hospitality, proptech, marketplaces/SaaS, and founder-led growth/marketing teams.

enrichment.personal_bio: Laura Deming is a New Zealand–born venture capitalist who founded The Longevity Fund to back early-stage companies working on aging and life-extension. She began laboratory work in biogerontology as a child, attended MIT as a teenager, and was a Thiel Fellow before launching the fund. She has led an accelerator and later initiatives (age1) focused on founder-led longevity companies.
enrichment.career_background: Deming moved from New Zealand to the U.S. to pursue aging research, worked in academic labs (including Cynthia Kenyon's), enrolled at MIT at a young age, accepted a Thiel Fellowship, and founded The Longevity Fund in 2011 to invest in longevity-focused startups. She has run an accelerator (AGE1), helped launch successor fund efforts (age1), and holds founder/board/advisor roles in several portfolio companies and ventures.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed to early-stage biotechnology and therapeutics targeting aging and age-related disease (geroscience, senolytics, gene editing, translational longevity platforms).

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Mischief, an early‑stage VC based in San Francisco. Previously founded Dote (Gen‑Z shopping app) and has been an active angel investor in companies such as Faire and Modern Fertility. Early career roles include Product Manager at Pocket Gems and Associate Consultant at Bain & Company. Graduated from Dartmouth College and grew up in Alaska.
enrichment.career_background: Lauren co‑founded Mischief (launched 2021) and invests at seed/Series A primarily in software startups. She was founder & CEO of Dote (2014–2020), earlier worked as a product manager at Pocket Gems and as an associate consultant at Bain & Company, and has angel investments dating back to 2017. She is based in San Francisco and holds a BA from Dartmouth College.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage software (seed & Series A); consumer products and marketplaces; fintech & payments; SaaS; crypto/web3; healthcare

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at First Round Capital (San Francisco) since 2023. Former co-founder & CEO of WayUp (launched 2014; raised >$40M; exited/merged in 2021) and Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator. Angel investor since 2016 with early-stage bets in Ramp, Scale AI and Ro.
enrichment.career_background: Worked in product marketing at Google before co-founding WayUp, where she served as CEO for seven years, raised venture capital and led the company through an exit in 2021. Began angel investing in 2016, later served as a Visiting Group Partner at Y Combinator (supporting 100+ startups) and joined First Round Capital as a Partner in 2023 focused on hands-on support for early-stage founders.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and pre-seed investments across enterprise/B2B SaaS, AI, fintech and healthtech; founder-first, GTM-heavy, hands-on early-stage partnering

enrichment.personal_bio: Managing Director on Redpoint’s growth / early‑growth team. Joined Redpoint in 2020 after several years at Battery Ventures and focuses primarily on enterprise software at the application and infrastructure layers, partnering with companies mostly at the Series B–C stage. Hosts a technology podcast and has been named to Forbes 30 Under 30 and the Midas Brink lists.
enrichment.career_background: Previously an investor at Battery Ventures (focused on enterprise software growth investments). Earlier experience in investment banking at Spurrier Capital Partners and Deutsche Bank. Holds a BS from Washington and Lee University, where he played varsity men’s lacrosse.
enrichment.investment_focus: Enterprise software (applications and infrastructure); growth‑stage investments (Series B and Series C).

enrichment.personal_bio: Founder of Founder Gym and former Kapor Capital portfolio services director; active angel investor and member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout. Works on training and funding underrepresented founders and early-stage startups.
enrichment.career_background: Entrepreneur and operator turned investor and operator. Co‑founded Tioki and later founded Founder Gym (an accelerator for underrepresented founders). Served as Global Director for Startup Weekend Education and Founding Portfolio Services Director at Kapor Capital. Member of First Round’s Angel Track and a Sequoia scout/angel investor; served as CEO of All Raise (2022–2023) and holds board/advisory roles in nonprofit and startup communities.
enrichment.investment_focus: Angel and scout investments in seed / early-stage startups, with emphasis on education, impact and consumer internet; supporting underrepresented founders.

enrichment.personal_bio: Operator-turned-investor and advisor focused on B2B SaaS and developer-led products. Former SVP, Marketing & Growth at Auth0 and interim CMO/advisor roles at Vercel and others. Serves as a GP/co-founder at HyperGrowth Partners and as a scout for Madrona; based in the Bay Area.
enrichment.career_background: Martin began as a software engineer and developer advocate, rose through growth/marketing leadership at Auth0 (SVP, Marketing & Growth), co‑founded HyperGrowth Partners (GP/GTM advisor) and has held interim CMO/advisor roles (e.g., Vercel, Deepgram). He is listed as a Madrona scout (2023) and makes angel/seed investments, focusing on marketing‑tech, developer platforms and SaaS.
enrichment.investment_focus: Seed and early-stage technology: B2B SaaS, developer tools, cloud & infra, applied AI, marketplaces

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Framework Ventures, a crypto‑native venture firm focused on DeFi and Web3. Previously co‑founded Hashletes and worked as a product manager at Dropbox and Snap. Attended Yale University.
enrichment.career_background: Michael Anderson co‑founded Framework Ventures in 2019 with Vance Spencer. Before Framework he co‑founded Hashletes (an NFL‑licensed digital collectibles startup) and was a product manager at Dropbox and Snap; he studied at Yale University and moved into crypto investing and protocol support thereafter.
enrichment.investment_focus: Early‑stage investments in DeFi and Web3 protocols, blockchain infrastructure, web3 gaming, and token‑based networks (tokenomics, governance).

enrichment.personal_bio: Serial entrepreneur and early-stage investor. Founder and Managing Partner of Heroic Ventures, founder and executive chairman of Reputation.com, and CEO/founder of Modelcode.ai. Known for work on online reputation management, digital privacy, and applied AI; author and occasional Harvard Law lecturer.
interests: Applied AI in Israel and Silicon Valley
enrichment.career_background: Michael Fertik is a founder‑operator turned VC: he co‑founded Reputation.com (now executive chairman), launched Heroic Ventures (managing partner) to lead formation and first‑money investments, and founded/operates Modelcode.ai. He holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School, is named on multiple patents, and has written and appeared widely on privacy, tech, and business topics.
enrichment.investment_focus: Formation / first‑money and early‑stage investments; software, AI, hardware, and life‑sciences startups (primarily Silicon Valley and Israel)

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder and General Partner at Newtopia VC. Former CTO and co‑founder of MURAL (Argentine unicorn) and earlier co‑founder of Three Melons (sold to Playdom/Disney). Active angel investor in Latin America.
enrichment.career_background: Serial entrepreneur and technologist: co‑founded Three Melons (video‑game studio; acquired by Playdom/Disney), co‑founded MURAL and served as CTO as it scaled to a global SaaS company, and transitioned to investing — serving as an angel investor in 30+ startups and as Co‑Founder & General Partner at Newtopia VC focused on early‑stage Latin American tech companies.
enrichment.investment_focus: Pre‑seed to Seed (select Series A follow‑ons) in Latin America; sectors include SaaS, fintech, healthtech, edtech, marketplaces/commerce, web3/crypto, and future‑of‑work solutions.

enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Matrix focusing on infrastructure and developer tooling investments. Former VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio and earlier program manager at Microsoft. Invests with product-led founders across pre-seed to Series A. Based in San Francisco.
enrichment.career_background: Product and operator background: program manager at Microsoft (2007–2011), VP of Product / GM Messaging at Twilio (2011–2018), joined Matrix as a partner in 2019 where he leads infrastructure and developer-focused investments. Educated in Human-Computer Interaction and Cognitive Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
enrichment.investment_focus: Infrastructure, developer tooling & APIs, B2B/SaaS; stages: pre-seed through Series A

enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Solana and a senior operator at Solana Labs, where he has led operations, product, and ecosystem growth. Active angel and strategic investor through Solana Ventures, focused on projects building on the Solana blockchain. Educational background includes the Wharton School (University of Pennsylvania).
enrichment.career_background: Raj Gokal co‑founded Solana and has served in senior operational and product roles at Solana Labs and the Solana Foundation. Earlier career experience includes venture investing at General Catalyst, co‑founding Sano (a consumer medical device startup), Director of Product at Omada Health, and an Entrepreneur‑in‑Residence at Rock Health. He studied economics/finance at the Wharton School.

enrichment.career_background: Founded Quantstamp and serves as its CEO, leading product and security strategy for smart‑contract audits and Web3 security services. enrichment.personal_bio: Partner at Lowercarbon Capital who leads the firm’s work on carbon removal. enrichment.personal_bio: Founding partner of Manifold Group (Chicago) and an early-stage investor involved in Manifold’s portfolio (~25+ companies while at the firm). enrichment.personal_bio: Product leader and advisor who helped build Stripe's early product efforts (notably Stripe Connect and Stripe Terminal) and previously held product roles at Google, Twitter, and Yahoo. CFA charterholder with a B.A. in Business Economics from UC Santa Barbara. Frequently quoted in industry press and holds board/advisor roles in portfolio companies.

enrichment.personal_bio: General Partner at Pioneer Fund based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Former founder of Graffiti Labs and Fearless (VR). Focuses on investing in YC‑ecosystem startups across seed through Series B, particularly in consumer internet, AI, e‑commerce, biotech and IoT.

He co‑founded Graffiti Labs (2007) and founded Fearless (virtual‑reality company), was a partner at an alumni/seed fund, and has served as a General/Managing Partner at Pioneer Fund since 2018. enrichment.personal_bio: Co‑founder of Framework Ventures, a San Francisco–based crypto‑native venture firm. Formerly co‑founder of Hashletes and BizOps at Netflix; earlier a management consultant at Monitor Deloitte. Active commentator and investor in DeFi, token economics, and web3 protocols.

enrichment.career_background: Trained as a clinician‑scientist (MBBS; postgraduate research at University of Oxford and Imperial College London), Vishal spent 15+ years in venture roles including Atlas Venture, Oxford Science Enterprises and as a venture partner at Molten Ventures (formerly DFJ/Draper Esprit). enrichment.personal_bio: Founder and Managing Partner at Mythos Ventures, an early-stage VC focused on prosocial AI and "AGI‑proof" companies. Previously co‑led AGI deployment strategy and worked in strategic communications at DeepMind, and led growth at Upstart. Yale University graduate.
